SEARCH
Package com.bankapp.models

Class Account

java.lang.Object
com.bankapp.models.Account
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Account>
Direct Known Subclasses:
CurrentAccount, SavingAccount
public class Account extends Object implements Comparable<Account>, Serializable
Represents a bank account within the bank application.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Account

      public Account(Client client, double balance, int RIB, Date openingDate, Date closingDate, boolean isDisabled, PaymentCollection payments, TransactionCollection transactions, LoanCollection loans)
      Constructs a new Account with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      client - the client who owns the account
      balance - the initial balance of the account
      RIB - the unique identifier for the account
      openingDate - the date the account was opened
      closingDate - the date the account will be closed
      isDisabled - whether the account is disabled
      payments - the collection of payments associated with the account
      transactions - the collection of transactions associated with the account
      loans - the collection of loans associated with the account

    • Account

      public Account(Client client, double balance, int RIB, Date openingDate, Date closingDate, boolean isDisabled)
      Constructs a new Account with the specified details, without payment, transaction, and loan collections.
      Parameters:
      client - the client who owns the account
      balance - the initial balance of the account
      RIB - the unique identifier for the account
      openingDate - the date the account was opened
      closingDate - the date the account will be closed
      isDisabled - whether the account is disabled

      public boolean deposit(double amount) throws InvalidDepositException
      Deposits a specified amount into the account.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to deposit
      Returns:
      true if the deposit was successful, false otherwise
      Throws:
      InvalidDepositException - if the deposit amount is not positive

    • withdraw

      public boolean withdraw(double amount) throws InsufficientFundsException
      Withdraws a specified amount from the account.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to withdraw
      Returns:
      true if the withdrawal was successful, false otherwise
      Throws:
      InsufficientFundsException - if the withdrawal amount is greater than the balance or not positive

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Account other)
      Compares this account to another account based on the RIB.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Account>
      Parameters:
      other - the other account to compare to
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this account's RIB is less than, equal to, or greater than the other account's RIB
